title: O Guardanapo
description: Web application for the snack-bar business O Guardanapo, built as a Turborepo monorepo with Next.js, TypeScript, Supabase, and a shared UI/infra toolkit.
subtitle: Web application for the snack-bar business O Guardanapo
overview: O Guardanapo is a web application for the snack-bar business built as a TypeScript monorepo using Next.js 15, Supabase, and a shared UI/infra toolkit. The repo is organized as a Turborepo + pnpm workspace with multiple apps (web, e2e) and reusable packages for UI, Supabase, routing, monitoring, i18n, mailers, and more.

coreConcept.summary: Improve my parents experience for creating and promoting the daily menu and products
bullets: Facilitate the creation and promotion of the daily menu and products
Increase the accessibility by providing different idioms to choose from
Provide additional information to the customers about the products and the business
Allow customers to interact with the business

features: Main web app in `apps/web` built on Next.js 15
Shared UI component library in `packages/ui` with Tailwind CSS and Radix UI
Supabase integration via `packages/supabase` for database, auth, and type-safe client utilities
Shared packages for routing, i18n, monitoring, and mailers
Data and scripts folders for CSV imports, seeding, and maintenance tasks

frontendStack: Radix UI primitives plus a custom `@kit/ui` component library
projectStructure: `packages/ui` for shared UI components and styling
Additional shared packages for routing, shared utilities, i18n, monitoring, and mailers
`tooling` directory for centralized ESLint, Prettier, Tailwind, and TypeScript configs
`data` and `scripts` directories for imports, translations, product transforms, and maintenance scripts
deployment: Build and deploy via Gitlab Pipelines
